reviews.review: Half-Life'ı oyunla alakası olan herkes bilir ve bir çok kişi Crossfire haritasında online oynamıştır. Ama Half-Life'ın çok başarılı bir de hikaye modu var. Konusunu kısaca değinelim. Ana karakterimiz Gordon Freeman bir teorik fizikçi ve Black Mesa Araştırma Tesisi'nde çalışıyor. Oyunun başında Gordon'un bir deneye 30 dakika geç kaldığını öğreniyoruz. Bu deney için gizemli bir karakter olan G-Man buradaki bilim insanlarına Xen Gezegeni'nden getirdiği bir kristali verir. Bilim insanları ise bu kristali yeterice incelemeden deneyde kullanırlar. Bunun sonucunda Xen Gezegeni ile dünya arasında bir portal açılır ve Xen Gezegeni'ndeki yaratıklar dünyaya geçer. Yapılan bu deney çok büyük bir karışıklığa sebep olur. Bu olay hükumetin kulağına gidince Black Mesa tesisine Black Ops Timi gönderilir ve Black Mesadaki herkesin öldürülmesini emreder. Oyun kısaca Gordon Freeman'ın hem askerlerle hem de yaratıklarla olan mücadelesini anlatıyor.

Para quem está com receio de comprar Half Life, está crítica é para você. Por mais que seja um jogo de 1998 e com gráficos chinfrins, ele com certeza compensa com sua campanha. A falta de diálogos com NPCs faz você descobrir o que está acontecendo no jogo por conta própria, deixando um ar de mistério, aumentando a sua curiosidade e consequentemente a aumentando sua vontade de terminar o jogo. Sem dúvida alguma este jogo vale seus 4, 10 ou até 20 reais. Não tenha receio, compre e se divirta.
A must-play game even though it is quite old its mechanics still holds to this day. I highly recommend giving it a try and good luck completing it without a walkthrough.

This game came out when I was 10. I first played it when I was in my 20's and now that I'm in my 30's, Half-Life is still a solid title. Playing through a classic like this will make modern gamers question what they're playing. Too many narrow platforms and some frustrating weapon aiming just takes time getting used to but hopefully won't destroy the experience. I definitely recommend playing this game before the legendary Half-Life 2 and it's expansions. 1998, is miss you so much! :(

For many years I've heard people rave about Half Life and how amazing it is. When I was younger, I didn't have a computer to play games on, so I never got the chance to play Half Life, and to find out for myself why it is such a beloved game to so many people. Then one day I saw the announcement trailer for Half Life Alyx and found out that Valve was letting people play Half Life for free in the months leading up to the release of Half Life Alyx and decided it was time to find out what was so special about this game. Starting out, I didn't really know what Half Life was about or what to expect from it. All I'd ever seen of it bits of a speedrun done at GDQ. I had no idea what I was about to get into. 

You play as a scientist  Dr. Gordan Freeman who works in a top secret military facility called Black Mesa. Your day starts with a science experiment, but during the experiment, something goes horribly wrong, causing aliens from a different dimension to invade Black Mesa. Your job is find a way to deal with this issue, using an ever growing arsenal of weapons to progress through Black Mesa to stop this alien threat. Once I started playing, I legitimately couldn't stop. I beat the game in 15 hours, and I think I put in half that time on the first day I started playing. All the weapons feel amazing, and you acquire them at regular intervals throughout the game, which gives you new and interesting ways to defeat your foes. Are you gonna lay down a tripwire to stop the enemy, toss a grenade at them, use your rifle, or just shotgun them in the face? The game is pretty easy at the beginning, but the difficulty ramps up as you progress, with the game throwing more difficult enemies and areas at you forcing you to get better at dealing with enemies while managing your ammo and keeping your health up. Some areas in the game gave me more trouble than others, but I didn't find this frustrating at all. I just kept adjusting my strategy until I found the one that worked. 

In conclusion, I cannot recommend this game enough. If you like first person shooters, enjoy games with a good story, and haven't played this game yet, what are you doing? Buy it. Right now. In no world do you ever regret buying Half Life. This game is a masterpiece and it does everything right. 

Thanks for reading, and Valve, please make Half Life 3.

Half-Life on release was a monumental game, with cutting edge graphical capabilities, revolutionary storytelling, and fast paced thrilling gameplay which established the now beloved valve software as a major player in the games industry. But if you think that this game has aged like anything but fine wine, you are wrong. as someone who hadn't played half life up until recently, I can confidently say that this game holds up remarkably. Everyone who enjoys FPS games should play this game at least once all the way through. The gameplay is fast paced, and requires a degree of thinking that will keep you on your toes. the storytelling is phenomenal and immersive, never taking you out of the shoes of Gordon Freeman as you watch events unfold around you. The soundtrack is great, though if I were to have one complaint about the whole game I wish the soundtrack would have kept playing a bit longer. I understand that it helps immerse you in the atmosphere by only having the soundtrack play occasionally during regular gameplay, but I feel that specifically during boss fights letting the music linger a while longer would be beneficial to the atmosphere. If you don't own this game already, but it. now. it's exceptionally priced, especially if you buy it as a part of one of the many bundles it's included in.

Half Life is an FPS game from the late 90s that, surprisingly, hasn’t aged all that poorly, given its age. Don’t get me wrong, the game looks and feels old, but it is still a fairly enjoyable experience. 
The only real problems I had with it are as follows:
The game will often ask the player to complete platforming challenges, and those can be really frustrating at times, given how slippery your character is when moving at his default speed.
Fall damage is way too high, you can lose more than a quarter of your max HP by falling from heights that usually would not even damage you in other games.
Climbing/Descending ladders can feel incredibly awkward.
The path ahead is not always clear. The game almost never directly tells you where you need to go, and while I do appreciate the lack of handholding, finding yourself in a situation you have absolutely no idea where to go or what to do will not be a rare occurrence, specially in the later parts of the game.
The music in the game might glitch out if you find yourself loading saves often.
The quality of the audio in general is bad, most sound effects and voices sound like they were recorded with a shitty Xbox 360 mic. I’ve seen older games with better audio.
The final boss is not particularly good, since you are forced to rely on a very inconsistent mechanic to get the final hit. 
The game might be a bit too lengthy. While the game will constantly put you in interesting scenarios, the overall simplicity of its gameplay might get you burned out by the end.
Those problems aside, the game can still be pretty fun. The gunplay is decent and the puzzles are well thought out in most cases. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who might be interested in checking out what might be the most influential game in the PC gaming industry.
